post.summary: Create a new tournament as the organizer.

application/json.name: My Weekly Tournament
application/json.registration_acceptance_message: You must now follow the next steps -> []
application/json.registration_refusal_message: Sorry, your registration has been refused.

get.description: Returns tournaments you organize with all organizer-specific data.
get.summary: Retrieve the tournaments you organize and have organized.

parameters.name: disciplines
parameters.description: One or several disciplines to filter.

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: One or several tournament statuses to filter.

parameters.name: scheduled_before
parameters.description: An ISO 8601 date (only the date part, with YYYY-MM-DD pattern) to include all tournaments scheduled to take place before or at the date.

parameters.name: scheduled_after
parameters.description: An ISO 8601 date (only the date part, with YYYY-MM-DD pattern) to include all tournaments scheduled to take place after or at the date.

parameters.name: countries
parameters.description: One or several countries to filter, with format ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes.

parameters.name: platforms
parameters.description: One or several platforms to filter.

parameters.name: is_online
parameters.description: Whether the tournament is played online.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived tournaments.

parameters.name: custom_user_identifier
parameters.description: An external custom user identifier. Use the format that suits your needs.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorts the collection in a particular order. "scheduled_asc" sorts the tournaments by scheduled date from the oldest to the most recent one; "scheduled_desc" sorts the tournaments by scheduled date from the most recent to the oldest one.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: (Required) A range of requested items using the 'tournaments' unit. The size of the range can not exceed 50. (see [Pagination](https://developer.toornament.com/v2/overview/pagination))

post.description: Creates a new registration for the user associated to the access token. The participant type of the tournament defines whether it expects a player or a team in the request body. If the registrations are disabled or closed, the endpoint will return a 403 (Access Denied).
post.summary: Create a new registration for the authenticated user.

get.description: Returns all stages of a tournament with basic information and settings.
get.summary: Retrieve all stages of a tournament.

parameters.name: tournament_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the tournament you want to retrieve data about.

get.description: Returns the bracket nodes of a stage. A bracket node represents a match and some extra data.
get.summary: Retrieve bracket nodes of a stage and tournament.

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: A list of group ids to filter.

parameters.name: group_numbers
parameters.description: A list of group numbers to filter.

parameters.name: round_ids
parameters.description: A list of round ids to filter.

parameters.name: round_numbers
parameters.description: A list of round numbers to filter.

parameters.name: min_depth
parameters.description: A minimum depth to filter.

parameters.name: max_depth
parameters.description: A maximal depth to filter.

parameters.name: tournament_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the tournament you want to retrieve data about.

parameters.name: stage_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the stage you want to retrieve data about.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: (Required) A range of requested items using the 'nodes' unit. The size of the range can not exceed 128. (see [Pagination](https://developer.toornament.com/v2/overview/pagination))

get.description: Returns the participants of the given tournament. The data provided in the participant depends on whether the participant type is team or player. This setting can be found in the tournament.
get.summary: Retrieve the participants of a tournament.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The string to be looked for in the name of the participant.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A method to sort the filtered data. “created_asc” and “created_desc” sort the participants from their creation date (earliest to latest, and inversely). “Alphabetic” sorts the participants using their case-insensitive names.

parameters.name: tournament_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the tournament the participants are from.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description: (Required) A range of requested items using the 'participants' unit. The size of the range can not exceed 50. (see [Pagination](https://developer.toornament.com/v2/overview/pagination))

post.description: Create a new match report in a match, there can only be one report per participant.Match reports are only available for "duel" type matches. Trying to POST a new report in a "ffa" type match will result in a 403 Error.
post.summary: Create a new match report in a match.

parameters.name: tournament_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the tournament to retrieve.

parameters.name: match_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the match.

get.description: Returns a participant identified with the given id. The data provided in the participant depends on whether the participant type is team or player. This setting can be found in the tournament.
get.summary: Retrieve a single participant of a tournament.

parameters.name: tournament_id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the tournament the participants are from.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: (Required) The id of the participant to retrieve.
